creator: davidsk

content:
The cert generated dynamically by Avast is for *.dreamhost.com or dreamhost.com. However, TB is trying to access the server sub5.mail.dreamhost.com. So there is no match, and therefore you do get the error message as per your third screenshot. You're prompted to create an exception because Avast will generate a new cert after every reboot.

I'd disable the silly SSL/TLS scanning in Avast. Or better yet, get rid of Avast altogether, and stick with Microsoft Defender.

content:
This seems likely to be a case where the prefs.js file in the profile is being prevented from updating preferences. That may be due to an antivirus or VPN or other software that may be interfering - or it may be as simple as the prefs.js being read-only. You can investigate this by these steps:

  1. click help>troubleshootinginformmaation
  2. scroll down to 'profiles' and click 'open folder'
  3. you are now in the profile. do you see more than one prefs file, such as prefs-1, prefs-2, etc? That would indicate that thunderbird keeps failing at attempts to update. Check whether prefs.js is read-only. Let me know what you find.

content: that there are 79 old prefs files indicates there have been problems. check the current prefs.js to see when it was last updated. That may help. And, although I can see the symptoms, I do not have a solution, as there could be many reasons for the file not being updated. You might also test by running help>troubleshootmode to see if you can save settings then

4. Thunderbird by mƒõl automaticky naj√≠t spr√°vn√° IMAP nastaven√≠: 

  * **P≈ô√≠choz√≠ (IMAP):** `imap.gmail.com`, port **993**, SSL/TLS   * **Odchoz√≠ (SMTP):** `smtp.gmail.com`, port **465 nebo 587**, SSL/TLS

content:
Riporta i messaggi di errore esatti, altrimenti √® difficile capire di che si tratta. Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content:
Controlla che i parametri siano quelli aggiornati forniti da TIM -> https://www.tim.it/assistenza/assistenza-tecnica/mail/configurazione/protocolli-posta#mail--alice-it

Tieni conto che per accedere da Client ad una casella TIM sono richieste delle condizioni Puoi accedere alla tua TIM Mail sia da webmail che da Client di posta (Gmail, Outlook,...) se: - hai una mail @tim.it @alice.it @tin.it associata a una linea attiva TIM fissa o mobile - hai una mail @tim.it @alice.it @tin.it non associata a una linea attiva TIM fissa o mobile ma sei connesso alla rete TIM fissa o mobile. -> https://www.tim.it/assistenza/assistenza-tecnica/mail/configurazione/client-pc

creator: davidsk

content:
The safe way I have used is this: Never MOVE, always COPY

  1. click file>offline>download to ensure all message content is local
  2. exit thunderbird (IMPORTANT)
  3. in windows file explorer, locate the desired folders in the imapmail\<accountname> folder
  4. COPY the folders to Mail\Local Folders
  5. start thunderbird and verify that messages are there 
You can now remove the IMAP account I encourage doing a backup, again, using Windows File Explorer.

content:
Harald W√ºnsch said
I have had an email address for 25 years (I don't want to lose it ‚Äì my children, grandchildren and friends know the address). Every time I generate a new password, I get the response "The incoming mail server is already in use". No other provider has this kind of rubbish. How can I solve this problem?

Is the account you're trying to add already present in Account Settings? When you generate a new account password, are you also generating an app password to use in TB in place of the account password?

https://www.telekom.de/hilfe/apps-dienste/e-mail/posteingang-postausgang-server?samChecked=true

If the account is already in TB, remove entries for the account from Settings/Privacy & Security, Saved Passwords, restart TB, enter the app password when asked for a password.

content: The concept here is to keep all messages that are on the server also on the PC, not necessarily (and NOT normally) in Local Folders. This process lets you go offline when desired and have all messages locally available. The settings allow you to keep all messages, or just the headers. It may help if you explicitly state what your intent is.
creator: davidsk

content:
Intent : Local copy of specifically sorted emails - this is done by thunderbird filter. Powershell script runs on those local copy emails, and catalogs specific information from the email to a spreadsheet.

That's my goal. My goal is to have that folder synced at least once a day without manual intervention.

John

Olona said
Hello, I organise my emails into folders by topic. I have lost two folders. Is it possible to recover them? How can I do this? I did not delete them; they have simply disappeared! I access my email using Thunderbird on my Mac and iPhone. Thank you for your help. Thank you!

If this is an IMAP account and the missing folders are visible in webmail, right-click the account in the Folder Pane, Subscribe..., Refresh, and see if they can be subscribed.
